handouts.name: Minor Arcana - Pentacles
handouts.notes:
Pentacles

This suit generally represents money, acquisition of fortune, trade

If there are many Pentacles in a reading. — Political action or intrigue

  • Element: Earth
  • Direction: East.
  • Animal: Bull
  • Occupation: Merchants

ACE OF PENTACLES

  • Beginning of prosperity, wealth
  • Upright card (keywords): The beginning of wealth and material gain. Gold, prosperity, combined with pleasure and beauty.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Miserliness, greed. A false start. Comfortable material conditions, which may not be to the advantage of the subject.

TWO OF PENTACLES

  • Handling two situations at once
  • Upright card (keywords): The ability to juggle two situations at one time. Lightheartedness, gaiety. Recreation. Harmony in the midst of change. New projects may be difficult to launch. News and messages in writing. A nature industrious yet unreliable, elated and then melancholic.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Enforced gaiety; inability to handle several situations at once. Simulated enjoyment.

THREE OF PENTACLES

  • The master craftsman; skill in arts and sciences
  • Upright card (keywords): Material increase. The master craftsman, the skilled artist. Gain in a commercial transaction. This is the card for members of the Masons and other groups and societies.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Lack of skill. Ignorance. Selfishness. Commonplace ideals; preoccupation with gain.

FOUR OF PENTACLES

  • Legacy; material possessions held tightly
  • Upright card (keywords): Assured material gain, success. Earthly power, but leading to nothing beyond it. Gifts, legacy, inheritance. May indicate a miserly, ungenerous character.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Prejudice, covetousness, suspicion. Hindrances. Setbacks in material ambitions. The spendthrift, too free with money. Chance of loss of earthly possessions.

FIVE OF PENTACLES

  • Loneliness, destitution
  • Upright card (keywords): Unemployment, destitution. Loss of home. Loneliness. Lovers unable to find a meeting place. Affinities discovered through similar troubles. Dark night of the soul.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Money regained after severe toil. New employment, but this may not be permanent. Charity. A new interest in spiritual matters.

SIX OF PENTACLES

  • Charity, gifts justly given
  • Upright card (keywords): Alms dispensed with justice; gifts, inheritance. Gain in material undertaking. Others will share with you justly. You will receive what you deserve.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Purse-proud. Jealous. Bad debts. Present prosperity threatened. Gifts given, but as a bribe.

SEVEN OF PENTACLES

  • A pause during growth
  • Upright card (keywords): Pause during the development of an enterprise. Unprofitable speculations. Loss of promising fortune. Disappointment. Anxiety about a loan. Success not attained.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Impatience. Little gain after much work. Again, anxiety about a loan.

EIGHT OF PENTACLES

  • Apprenticeship, small skills, employment to come
  • Upright card (keywords): Learning a trade or profession. The beginning of a profitable undertaking. Employment or commission to come. Skill in material affairs, handiwork, and the arts—sometimes remaining only in the apprenticeship stage.
  • Reversed card (keywords): There is danger of failing in one’s ambitions. False vanity, intrigue, and sharp practice. Skill turned to cunning, like that of a counterfeiter.

NINE OF PENTACLES

  • Solitary enjoyment of wealth
  • Upright card (keywords): Solitary enjoyment of the good things of life. Inheritance. Wisdom where one’s own interests lie. A person and a green thumb. Material well-being. Caution: be prudent. Great love of gardens and home.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Danger from thieves, cancelled project. Possible loss of home or friendship. Move with caution.

TEN OF PENTACLES

  • Established family of wealth, inheritance
  • Upright card (keywords): Riches, inheritance. Attention to family matters, interest in one’s ancestral tree. A problem concerning a will or pension. May refer to the acquiring of a house or a business property.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Family misfortune; old people may become a burden. Loss of inheritance. Caution against getting involved in projects that are a poor risk.

PAGE OF PENTACLES

  • Studious youth or girl. Favorable news
  • Upright card (keywords): Respect for learning and new ideas. A scholar. A typical introvert. Can also mean application; reflection. Good management, carefulness. The bringer of good news and messages about money.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Dissipation and excess. Too great pleasure in the material things of life. Wastefulness, luxury. News of the loss of money or wordly goods.

KNIGHT OF PENTACLES

  • Dark, methodical young man, patient and responsible
  • Upright card (keywords): A man of upright nature who accepts responsibility. He is laborious and patient. The card can also mean utility, serviceableness, trustworthiness. Or the coming or going of an important matter connected with money.
  • Reversed card (keywords): A static nature that is unprogressive, dull, timid, idle, or careless. It indicates stagnation in one’s affairs.

QUEEN OF PENTACLES

  • A dark woman with black eyes, intelligent and thoughtful, lavish with her wealth
  • Upright card (keywords): This is a woman who is the Earth Mother, generous with her gifts. She is rich but charitable, a truly noble soul. A creator on the physical plane. Other meanings are opulence; security. Trust of those around one. At times melancholy or moody. Good use of practical talents.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Mistrust, suspicion. Duties neglected. Dependence on others. Changeable. Fearful of failure.

KING OF PENTACLES

  • A chief of industry; mathematical gifts; generosity, affection
  • Upright card (keywords): This is a chief of industry, a banker, or owner of large estates. He is a reliable married man and a mathematician with great financial gifts. The card can also betoken a steady temperament, slow to anger; success where money matters are concerned and reliability.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Stupidity. Perverse use of talents. Thriftless. Easy to bribe. Vice. Caution against association with gamblers and speculators. If crossed, he could be a dangerous man.

handouts.name: Minor Arcana - Swords
handouts.notes:
Swords

This is the suit of misfortune and disaster.

If there are many Swords in a reading. — Strife

  • Element: Air
  • Direction: North
  • Animal: Eagle
  • Occupation: Warriors.

ACE OF SWORDS

  • Conquest, victory
  • Upright card (keywords): Conquest, triumph of power, great activity. The power to love strongly or to hate. Possible birth of a child who will be of heroic temperament. Championship.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Conquest, but the results are disastrous. Obstacles, great loss, infertility.

TWO OF SWORDS

  • Balanced forces, indecision
  • Upright card (keywords): Tension in relationships. Indecision. Balanced forces. Military friendships. A well-developed sense of balance and rhythm but needing direction. Stalemate.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Release, movement of affairs, sometimes in the wrong direction. Avoid impostors. Sympathy for those in trouble. Disloyalty.

THREE OF SWORDS

  • Sorrow, separation
  • Upright card (keywords): Stormy weather for the affections. Tears, separation, quarreling. A general upheaval of the environment. Possibility of civil war. Political strife.
  • Reversed card (keywords): There is still confusion, loss, sorrow, upheaval, but in lesser degree.

FOUR OF SWORDS

  • Solitude, change for the better
  • Upright card (keywords): Hermit’s repose. Rest after war. Banishment. Relaxation of anxiety, release from suffering. There will soon be a change for the better. Not a card of death.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Renewed activity; qualified success. Movement in one’s affairs; social unrest. A caution to be wise, circumspect, and economical.

FIVE OF SWORDS

  • An empty victory
  • Upright card (keywords): Failure, defeat. Degradation. Conquest of others. Unfairness, slander, cruelty, cowardliness.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Beware of pride. There is a chance of loss or defeat. Attendance at a funeral. Empty victory. Sorrow. Weakness.

SIX OF SWORDS

  • Journey by water; difficulties fade away
  • Upright card (keywords): The future will he better. Success after anxieties. Journey to a new home, by water. Sending someone to represent you in an undertaking. Also a journey in consciousness.
  • Reversed card (keywords): You will stay where you are. No immediate way out of present difficulties. Unfavorable issue of a lawsuit or other undertaking.

SEVEN OF SWORDS

  • A plan may fail
  • Upright card (keywords): A plan that may fail. An unwise attempt to make away with what is not yours. Unstable effort. Arguments over plans. Spying on another. Partial success.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Possibility of unexpected good. Sound advice. Instruction. Wishes about to be fulfilled.

EIGHT OF SWORDS

  • Bondage, restricted surroundings
  • Upright card (keywords): Narrow or restricted surroundings. Bondage. Imprisonment through indecision. Betrayal. Fear to move out of a situation. Temporary sickness.
  • Reversed card (keywords): New beginnings now possible. Impulsive, generous nature. Relaxation from fear. Freedom.

NINE OF SWORDS

  • Desolation, sorrow over another
  • Upright card (keywords): Suffering, loss, misery. Burden, oppression. Doubt and desolation. Illness. May mean death of a loved one.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Patience, unselfishness. Time brings healing. Tomorrow is another day.

TEN OF SWORDS

  • Misfortune, pain, ruin
  • Upright card (keywords): Though the Nine of Swords showed despair, the meaning here is even more serious. Ruin of plans and projects. Defeat in war. Disruption of home life. Tears will fall. Trouble will come in spite of riches and high position. Not a card of violent death. A suggestion to give charity freely to those in trouble.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Overthrow of evil forces. Some success and profit. Courage to rise again. In spiritual matters, looking to higher powers for help.

PAGE OF SWORDS

  • An active young man or girl. Upsetting message
  • Upright card (keywords): A young person who might be a page in the diplomatic or government service. He or she already has great understanding and knows how to use diplomacy. This card can also mean a message and certain types of spying, as well as grace and dexterity.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Impostor, likely to be exposed. Frivolity and cunning. Possibility of ill health. Be prepared for the unexpected.

KNIGHT OF SWORDS

  • Chivalrous young man, quick to defend or fight. Coming or going of a matter
  • Upright card (keywords): A dashing, brave young man. Though he may be domineering, he has a clean heart and is full of courage. The card may also mean the coming or going of misfortune.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Extravagance. Given to braggadocio. Tyranny over the helpless, be it man or animal. A person always ready to start a fight. Destruction may come about through the knight’s activities.

QUEEN OF SWORDS

  • A dark woman of strong character, acquainted with fortune
  • Upright card (keywords): A subtle, keen, and quick-witted woman who may represent a widow or one who is unable to bear children. Perhaps she is mourning for those she loves who are far away from her. This card may mean widowhood, mourning, privation. Kindness but also firmness. Keen observation. Gracefulness; fondness for dancing.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Unreliability. Narrow-mindedness. Gossip. Deceit, Malice. A woman of artifice and prudery.

KING OF SWORDS

  • A dark man with military or civilian authority
  • Upright card (keywords): This is a man who may be a lawyer, a judge, a general, or a governor. He gives wise counsel, is firm in enmity as well as in friendship. A man of many ideas, thoughts, and designs. The card may also mean power, strength, authority, or military intelligence. A lawsuit is in the offing.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Distrustful, suspicious. Also harsh and malicious. Plotting, barbarity, power for disruption, are revealed.

handouts.name: Minor Arcana - Cups
handouts.notes:
Cups

This suit generally betokens love and happiness.

If there are many Cups in a reading. — Love, Goodness

  • Element: Water
  • Direction: West.
  • Animal: Whale
  • Occupation: Priest.

ACE OF CUPS

  • Beginning of love, joy, fertility
  • Upright card (keywords): The beginning of great love. Joy, contentment. Productiveness, fertility. Beauty and pleasure. A reminder that when the mind is filled with Spirit, the Spirit will fill the material cup to overflowing.
  • Reversed card (keywords): False love. Clouded joy. Instability. Hesitancy to nurture love.

TWO OF CUPS

  • Love af air, deep friendship
  • Upright card (keywords): Harmony of the masculine and the feminine. Reciprocity, the beginning of a friendship or love affair. Balance of ideas and plans with a kindred soul.
  • Reversed card (keywords): False love, dissipation, folly, violent passion, disunity, misunderstanding.

THREE OF CUPS

  • Health, abundance
  • Upright card (keywords): Success, abundance. Good luck, fortune, victory. Happy issue of an undertaking. Hospitality. Pleasure.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Too much sensuality, overindulgence in food and drink. Pleasure turns to pain, success to ashes.

FOUR OF CUPS

  • Discontent, reevaluation
  • Upright card (keywords): A stationary period in one’s life; weariness, surfeit. Dissatisfaction with material success. Reevaluation of one’s earthly pleasures. Kindness from others.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Waking from a period of contentment or contemplation. New relationships now possible. New goals, new ambition.

FIVE OF CUPS

  • Regret, rejection of pleasure
  • Upright card (keywords): Disappointment. Sorrow in those things from which pleasure was expected. Disillusionments in love. Marriage broken up. Loss of friendship. Vain regret; loss, but with something left over.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Return of enjoyment. New alliances formed. Return of an old friend or loved one. Hopeful expectations.

SIX OF CUPS

  • Happy memories
  • Upright card (keywords): Happiness, enjoyment, but coming from the past. Meeting with a childhood acquaintance. Pleasant memories. Or this card may mean new friendships. A gift from an admirer. New knowledge and new opportunities.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Living too much in the past. Clinging to outworn morals and manners. Worthless associates. Possibility of an inheritance or gift from the past.

SEVEN OF CUPS

  • Castles in the air
  • Upright card (keywords): Dreams, castles in the air, an imagination that has been working overtime. The seeker’s forces have been too scattered. Illusionary success. Selfish dissipation; deception.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Good resolutions. Slight success must be followed up. New will and determination. Intelligent selection.

EIGHT OF CUPS

  • Abandoning present situation
  • Upright card (keywords): Things thrown aside as soon as gained. Journeying from place to place. Misery and repining without cause. Disappointment in love. The seeker may desire to leave material success for something higher. Success abandoned.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Interest in success. Joy, feasting, a new love. The spiritual abandoned for the material.

NINE OF CUPS

  • Material wealth
  • Upright card (keywords): Material success, satisfaction. All the good things of life are available. The subject will get his wish. Physical well-being.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Misplaced reliance; false freedom. There may be some deprivation or illness, or overindulgence in food and drink. The subject’s wish will not be fulfilled.

TEN OF CUPS

  • Happy family life
  • Upright card (keywords): Contentment. Lasting happiness because it is inspired from above rather than being the sensual satisfaction indicated in the Nine of Cups. Perfection of human love. Great friendship. Lasting success. Peacemaking.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Loss of friendship. Betrayal. Wantonness, waste. Criminal satisfactions.

PAGE OF CUPS

  • Captivating boy or girl. Studious, friendly
  • Upright card (keywords): A melancholy and passionate youth, studious but given to flights of imagination. Willing to render service to the subject. If this card does not signify a youth, it will mean the subject is drawn to the arts, is given to meditation. News, a message, perhaps the birth of a child. New business methods proposed.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Little desire to create. Dilettantism. Good taste. Seduction. A deception may soon be uncovered. Obstacles. Unpleasant news.

KNIGHT OF CUPS

  • A romantic young man. He brings proposals and invitations
  • Upright card (keywords): A young man who is graceful, poetic, but indolent. He is a dreamer of sensual delights. Can mean the bringer of a message, a proposition, an invitation.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Sensual, idle, untruthful. Swindling, trickery, fraud. Propositions should be carefully looked into.

QUEEN OF CUPS

  • A romantic woman with intuition. A good wife and mother
  • Upright card (keywords): A woman who is able to put into practice what her visions decree. She is the good wife and mother—honest, devoted, and loyal. If the subject does not recognize such a woman in his or her life, then someone with vision should be considered, or someone who is kind though not willing to take too much trouble for another. Success, happiness, pleasure are indicated.
  • Reversed card (keywords): A perverse character. Intelligent but not to be relied on. Dishonesty. Immorality.

KING OF CUPS

  • A reliable man of business, law, or divinity
  • Upright card (keywords): This man is skilled in both law and trade. He may be connected with either a church or a worldly institution. He is kind and considerate and willing to take responsibility. If such a man is not indicated, then look for traits of liberality, generosity, consideration, creative intelligence, and interest in arts and religion.
  • Reversed card (keywords): A powerful man, but likely to be crafty and violent. A fierce nature under a calm exterior. Double dealing. Beware of being robbed of either virtue or money.

handouts.name: Minor Arcana - Wands
handouts.notes:
Wands

This suit indicates animation and enterprise, energy and growth.

If there are many Wands in a reading. — Change

  • Element: Fire
  • Direction: South.
  • Animal: Lion.
  • Occupation: Laborer.

ACE OF WANDS

  • Beginning of fortune or family
  • Upright card (keywords): Beginning of an enterprise, invention, or the beginning of a family. Perhaps the beginning of a journey, an adventure, an escapade.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Canceling of new enterprise, journey deferred, clouded joy, false starts.

TWO OF WANDS

  • Success in business
  • Upright card (keywords): Boldness, courage in embarking on an enterprise. The employment of scientific methods. Influence over another. Kindness and generosity—yet a proud and unforgiving nature.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Restlessness, obstinacy, fear, physical suffering. The good beginning has turned against the subject.

THREE OF WANDS

  • A partnership, help offered
  • Upright card (keywords): Realization of hope, established strength, nobility, wealth, power. Caution against pride and arrogance. Partnership. Help will be offered by a successful merchant.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Beware of help offered. Wealth may slip away. There may be treachery and disappointment.

FOUR OF WANDS

  • Romance, harvest, home
  • Upright card (keywords): Perfected work; rest after labor. Peace, prosperity, harmony. Romance, a coming marriage.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Though the meaning remains the same, there will not be quite the same fullness of peace, prosperity, and success.

FIVE OF WANDS

  • Struggle, competition
  • Upright card (keywords): Violent strife, rashness, competition. In the battle of life, boldness changes things for the better. Obstacles. Lawsuit.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Generosity. New business opportunities. Victory after surmounting obstacles.

SIX OF WANDS

  • Success, good news
  • Upright card (keywords): Good news. Victory after strife. Pleasure gained through labor. Success through industry. Advancement in the arts and sciences. Friends are helpful.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Rewards are delayed. Insolence of the victorious. Watch for successful enemy.

SEVEN OF WANDS

  • Courage in difficult situations
  • Upright card (keywords): Victory through courage. Success against opposition. The subject has the position of advantage. Competition in business or trade. Certain success.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Ignorance, pretense. The subject is threatened. Caution against indecision.

EIGHT OF WANDS

  • Swift action, journey, message
  • Upright card (keywords): Great haste, great hope, too rapid advancement. That which is on the move. Hasty communication. Messages, letters of love. Approach to a goal. Journey by air.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Delay, stagnation in business or affairs of the heart. Jealousy.

NINE OF WANDS

  • Strength to overcome trouble
  • Upright card (keywords): The pause in a struggle. Preparedness, strength in reserve. Eventual victory but steady force must be applied. Obstinacy, strength, power, health.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Weakness, ill health, adversity, displeasure, obstacles to be overcome.

TEN OF WANDS

  • Heart tried by pain
  • Upright card (keywords): Force and energy applied to selfish ends. Power unwisely used. Carrying a burden of ill-regulated power. Here is also a refining test by fire, the heart tried by pain. Problem soon to be solved.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Intrigues, separation, emigration. If a lawsuit is pending, there will be some loss.

PAGE OF WANDS

  • A young lover, a messenger
  • Upright card (keywords): Courage, beauty. A nature sudden in love or anger. Desire for power; enthusiasm. A messenger or postman. A bearer of tidings. If this card appears in a spread next to one representing a man, there will be favorable testimony concerning him.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Cruel, unstable, domineering. If you are a woman, he may break your heart. Announcing bad news.

KNIGHT OF WANDS

  • Impetuous young man. Journey by water, the coming or going of a matter
  • Upright card (keywords): A young man, possibly a warrior, filled with energy. He can be a generous friend or lover, but is also likely to be cruel and brutal. He is hasty in all he does. May also mean change of residence, emigration, quick departure. Knights in a spread may also mean the coming or going of a matter.
  • Reversed card (keywords): The would-be lover turns jealous, creates conflict. Discord, frustration, lack of energy. Work interfered with.

QUEEN OF WANDS

  • A blond woman who is both home- and nature-loving; Honest and practical
  • Upright card (keywords): She has great power to attract that which she wants, and is fruitful in mind and body. Loving nature and her home, she is practical with money and sound in her business judgments. If she does not represent a woman, then she represents these qualities: success in undertakings; love of home and growing things; kindness and generosity.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Domineering, obstinate, revengeful; likely to turn suddenly against another without cause. If married, she could be unfaithful.

KING OF WANDS

  • A blond married man of authority. Devoted friend
  • Upright card (keywords): Handsome and passionate, he is agile in mind and body. A country gentleman, generally married. Loyal and noble, he comes of good family. Sometimes he is too hasty. If no man seems to be involved in the spread of cards, you will find these traits: honesty, friendliness, passion. The card may mean unexpected heritage; a good marriage.
  • Reversed card (keywords): Intolerant, prejudiced, ill-natured. High-principled to a fault. Severe and ruthless.

handouts.name: Major Arcana Cards
handouts.notes:
THE FOOL

  • A choice is offered
  • Meaning: The Fool represents new beginnings, having faith in the future, being inexperienced, not knowing what to expect, having beginner's luck, improvisation and believing in the universe.
  • Upright card (keywords): Beginnings, Innocence, Leap of faith, Originality, Spontaneity
  • Reversed card (keywords): Chaos, Folly, Lack of direction, Naivety, Poor judgement, Stupidity
  • Element: Air
  • Deity: Dionysus

THE MAGICIAN

  • Creative power
  • Meaning: When the Magician appears in a spread, it points to the talents, capabilities and resources at the querent's disposal to succeed. The message is to tap into one's full potential rather than holding back, especially when there is a need to transform something.
  • Upright card (keywords): Determined, Dexterity, Resourceful, Skilled, Strong powerful man
  • Reversed card (keywords): Communication blocks, Confusion, Deceit, Ill intentions, Lack of energy
  • Element: Air
  • Deity: Promethius


THE HIGH PRIESTESS

  • Hidden influences
  • Meaning: High Priestess is a card of mystery, stillness and passivity. This card suggests that it is time to retreat and reflect upon the situation and trust your inner instincts to guide you through it. Things around you are not what they appear to be right now.
  • Upright card (keywords): Hidden talents, Intuition, Mystery, Spiritual insight, Things yet to be revealed
  • Reversed card (keywords): Information withheld, Lack of personal harmony, Secrets
  • Element: Water
  • Deity: Persephone


THE EMPRESS

  • Material abundance, fertility
  • Meaning: The Empress is traditionally associated with maternal influence, it is the card if you are hoping to start a family. She can represent the creation of life, romance, art, or new business.
  • Upright card (keywords): A new opportunity, Abundance, Maternal care, Nuturing, Pregnancy, Stability
  • Reversed card (keywords): Domestic problems, Financial issues, Stagnation, Unwanted pregnancy
  • Element: Earth
  • Deity: Demeter


THE EMPEROR

  • Leadership
  • Meaning: This card is suggestive of stability and security in life. You are on top of things and everything in under your control. It is your hard work, discipline and self control that have bought you this far. It means that you are in charge of your life now setting up your own rules and boundaries.
  • Upright card (keywords): Authority, Father figure, Law and order, Leadership, Power, Promotion
  • Reversed card (keywords): Control freak, Immaturity, Lack of discipline, Loss of authority, Manipulative friends
  • Element: Fire
  • Deity: Zeus


THE HIEROPHANT

  • Rule by the conventional
  • Meaning: Hierophant stands for tradition and convention. It can represent marriage in an arranged setup. It can also mean a teacher or counsellor who will help in learning / education of the querent.
  • Upright card (keywords): Education, Learning, Marriage, Religion, Seeking counsel or advice, Spiritual guidance, Tradition
  • Reversed card (keywords): Abuse of position, Breakdown, Poor counsel, Rejection of family values
  • Element: Earth
  • Deity: Chiron


THE LOVERS

  • Choice between two loves
  • Meaning: The Lovers represent relationships and choices. Its appearance in a spread indicates some decision about an existing relationship, a temptation of the heart, or a choice of potential partners. Often an aspect of the querent's life will have to be sacrificed; a bachelor(ette)'s lifestyle may be sacrificed and a relationship gained (or vice versa), or one potential partner may be chosen while another is turned down. Whatever the choice, it should not be made lightly, as the ramifications will be lasting.
  • Upright card (keywords): Being at a crossroads, Choices, Commitment, Falling in love, Partnerships
  • Reversed card (keywords): Broken relationship, Infidelity, Relationship issues, Separation
  • Element: Air
  • Deity: Hera, Aphrodite and Athena


THE CHARIOT

  • Conquest of mind over emotions
  • Meaning: The Chariot is a card about overcoming conflicts and moving forward in a positive direction. One needs to keep going on and through sheer hard work and commitment he will be victorious.
  • Upright card (keywords): A journey, Ambition, Confidence, Drive, Overcoming obstacles, Will power
  • Reversed card (keywords): Lack of direction, Scattered energy, Self doubt
  • Element: Water
  • Deity: Ares


STRENGTH

  • Triumph of love over hate
  • Meaning: Strength predicts the triumphant conclusion to a major life problem, situation or temptation through strength of character. It is a very happy card if you are fighting illness or recovering from injury.
  • Upright card (keywords): Confidence, Enjoying power, Inner strength, Potency, Self-belief, Virility, Vitality
  • Reversed card (keywords): Hedonism, Lack of self-control, Lacking courage, Self-doubt, Vanity
  • Element: Fire
  • Deity: Heracles


THE HERMIT

  • Wisdom offered
  • Meaning: The Hermit suggests that you are in a phase of introspection where you are drawing your attention inwards and looking for answers within. You are in need of a period of inner reflection, away from the current demands of your position.
  • Upright card (keywords): Introspection, Meditation, Self-reflection, Solitude, Soul-searching, Withdrawn from society
  • Reversed card (keywords): Exile, Loneliness, Misfit, Sadness, Withdrawing from loved ones
  • Element: Earth
  • Deity:


THE WHEEL OF FORTUNE

  • Ups and downs of life, good luck
  • Meaning: A common aspect to most interpretations of this card within a reading is to introduce an element of change in the querent's life, such change being in station, position or fortune: such as the rich becoming poor, or the poor becoming rich.
  • Upright card (keywords): Chance, Changes, Destiny, Luck, Opportunity, Winning
  • Reversed card (keywords): Bad luck, Disappointment, Misfortune, Mishap, Unforeseen setback
  • Element: Fire
  • Deity: The Moirai


JUSTICE

  • Balance, legal matters
  • Meaning: The Justice card indicates that the fairest decision will be made. Justice is the sword that cuts through a situation, and will not be swayed by outer beauty when deciding what is fair and just.
  • Upright card (keywords): Balance and equilibrium, Cause and effect, Fairness, Justice, Responsibilty
  • Reversed card (keywords): Dishonesty, Imbalance, Lack of accountability, Legal flaws, Unfair treatment
  • Element: Air
  • Deity: Athena


THE HANGED MAN

  • Self-surrender to higher wisdom
  • Meaning: The Hanged Man is the card that suggests ultimate surrender, sacrifice, or being suspended in time.
  • Upright card (keywords): Breaking old patterns, Circumspection, Letting go, Metamorphosis, Suspension
  • Reversed card (keywords): Egotism, Inability to change, Missing an opportunity
  • Element: Water
  • Deity: Prometheus


DEATH

  • Change, renewal
  • Meaning: Unlikely that this card actually represents a physical death. Typically it implies an end, possibly of a relationship or interest, and therefore implies an increased sense of self-awareness.
  • Upright card (keywords): Endings, Failure, Letting go of attachments, Mortality, Profound change, Severe illness
  • Reversed card (keywords): Delayed endings, Depression, Living unaware, Long terminal illness, Resistance to change
  • Element: Water
  • Deity: Hades


TEMPERANCE

  • Adaptation, coordination
  • Meaning: This card indicates that you should learn to bring about balance, patience and moderation in your life. You should take the middle road, avoiding extremes and maintain a sense of calm.
  • Upright card (keywords): Alchemy, Balance, Connecting with your guides, Harmony, Looking for divine intervention, Moderation
  • Reversed card (keywords): Disharmony, Imbalance, Lack of patience, Onset of illness
  • Element: Fire
  • Deity: Iris


THE DEVIL

  • Temptation, bondage to the material
  • Meaning: It represents being seduced by the material world and physical pleasures. Also living in fear, domination and bondage, being caged by an overabundance of luxury, discretion should be used in personal and business matters.
  • Upright card (keywords): Bondage, Enslavement, Fear, Feeling trapped, Materialism, Temptation, Unhealthy relationships
  • Reversed card (keywords): Breaking from addictions, Divorce, Freedom from restraints
  • Element: Earth
  • Deity: Pan


THE TOWER

  • Overthrow of selfish ambition
  • Meaning: The Tower is commonly interpreted as meaning danger, crisis, destruction, and liberation. It is associated with sudden unforseen change.
  • Upright card (keywords): Accident or damage, Catastrophe, Destruction, Renovation, Unexpected change
  • Reversed card (keywords): Illness, Losses, Obstacles, Volatile situation
  • Element: Fire
  • Deity: Poseidon


THE STAR

  • Health, hope, inspiration
  • Meaning: When the Star card appears, you are likely to find yourself feeling inspired. It brings renewed hope and faith and a sense that you are truly blessed by the universe at this time.
  • Upright card (keywords): Astronomy, Good health, Hope, Inspiration, Opportunities, Spirituality
  • Reversed card (keywords): Despair, Disappointments, Illness, Missed opportunities
  • Element: Air
  • Deity: Pandora


THE MOON

  • Deception, unforeseen perils
  • Meaning: The Moon is a card of illusion and deception, and therefore often suggests a time when something is not as it appears to be. Perhaps a misunderstanding on your part, or a truth you cannot admit to yourself.
  • Upright card (keywords): Deception, Difficult period, Fear, Hidden things, Insecurity, Mental confusion
  • Reversed card (keywords): Insomnia, Mysteries unveiled, Release of fear, Unhappiness, Unusual dreams
  • Element: Water
  • Deity: Hecate


THE SUN

  • Attainment, liberation, marriage
  • Meaning: The card portends good fortune, happiness, joy and harmony. It represents the universe coming together and agreeing with your path and aiding forward movement into something greater.
  • Upright card (keywords): Enlightment, Joy, Marriage, Material happiness, Success, Vitality
  • Reversed card (keywords): False impressions, Lack of clarity, Low Vitality, Sadness
  • Element: Fire
  • Deity: Apollo


JUDGMENT

  • Spiritual awakening
  • Meaning: This card is referred to as a time of resurrection and awakening, a time when a period of our life comes to an absolute end making way for dynamic new beginnings.
  • Upright card (keywords): Awakening, Decision making, Redemption, Reincarnation, Renewal, Transition
  • Reversed card (keywords): Poor logic, Poor or hasty judgement, Self-doubt, Stagnation
  • Element: Fire
  • Deity: Hermes


THE WORLD

  • Triumph in all undertakings
  • Meaning: The World represents an ending to a cycle of life, a pause in life before the next big cycle beginning with the fool. It is an indicator of a major and inexorable change, of tectonic breadth.
  • Upright card (keywords): Achievement, Fulfillment, Possibilities, Successful conclusions
  • Reversed card (keywords): Delayed success, Failed plans, Lack of completion, Stagnation
  • Element: Earth
  • Deity: Hermaphroditus
